name: CSP with Backtracking
description: Solves constraint satisfaction problems by assigning variables and backtracking when constraints are violated
when_to_use: Constraint satisfaction problems (CSP) with finite domains
when_not_to_use: Very large domains without strong constraint propagation
When optimal solution with objective function is needed (use branch-and-bound)
Highly connected constraint graphs without good heuristics

complexity.time: O(d^n) worst case where d = domain size, n = variables; highly dependent on constraint structure
complexity.space: O(n * d) for variable domains and assignments

embedding_text: Backtracking search for CSPs systematically assigns variable values and backtracks upon constraint violation. Key optimizations: Minimum Remaining Values (MRV) heuristic for variable selection, forward checking for early detection of failures, arc consistency (AC-3) for constraint propagation. Complete algorithm guaranteed to find solution if one exists.
